question: NBA: Will the Bucks beat the 76ers by more than 6.5 points in their November 9th matchup?
description:
In the upcoming NBA game, scheduled for November 9th:

If the Milwaukee Bucks win by over 6.5 points, the market will resolve to “Yes”.

If the Philadelphia 76ers lose by less than 6.5 points or win, the market will resolve “No.” 

If the game is not completed by November 16, 2021, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: International soccer: Will there be 4 or more goals in Germany v. Liechtenstein game on November 11?
description:
This market is about the upcoming UEFA 2022 World Cup Qualifier game between Germany and Liechtenstein national soccer teams, scheduled to take place on November 11, 2:45 pm ET, in Wolfsburg, Germany.

If there are 4 or more total goals scored, this market will resolve to “Yes”. 
Otherwise, this market will resolve “No.” 

If the game is not completed by November 19, 2021, the market will resolve 50-50.

Note, that this market is about the sum of the goals scored which count for the game result, in regular and extra time. Disallowed goals do not count.

question: Will the floor price of CryptoPunks be above 85 ETH on November 15?
description:
This is a market on whether CryptoPunks will maintain a price floor over 85 ETH on November 15, 2021, at 12:00 PM ET. 

This market will resolve to "Yes" if, on the aforementioned check time, there are no CryptoPunks (on https://www.larvalabs.com/cryptopunks/forsale#) listed for 85 ETH or lower, and “No” otherwise. 

Only listings that have existed for at least an hour are valid for this market (as verified by the transaction hash time).

question: Will The Build Back Better Act pass the House of Representatives by November 19, 2021?
description:
This is a market on whether the U.S. House of Representatives will pass the Build Back Better Act (H.R.5376) before November 19th 2021, 11:59:59 pm ET.

This market will resolve to “Yes”, if H.R.5376 has “Passed House” (according to https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/house-bill/5376), or indicates it has passed the house under the "Actions" tab by the resolution date, and "No" otherwise.

Credible news reports will be sufficient if the primary source is not updated by the resolution time. 

---------------
This bill has been introduced in House on September 27th 2021 and is commonly referred to as the Build Back Better Act.

According to Congressional Research Service, this bill provides funding, establishes programs, and otherwise modifies provisions relating to a broad array of areas, including education, labor, child care, health care, taxes, immigration, and the environment.

question: Will $MATIC (Polygon) be above $1.80 on November 14?
description:
This is a market on whether the candlestick close price of Polygon $MATIC will be above $1.80 for the date and time of November 14, 2021, at 11:30 PM ET. 

The resolution source for this market will be prices listed on CoinGecko (https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/polygon). 

This market will resolve to “Yes” if, according to the resolution source, $MATIC has a candlestick closing price of greater than $1.80 for the resolution date, November 14, 2021, 11:30 PM ET after 11:30 PM ET has passed. 
Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”. 

(To see the candlestick close price, click the candlestick icon, observe the number after the “C:” when you hover over a candlestick for a given time period.)

This market will resolve on the “C” (i.e. closing price) listed for the candle titled “Sun 14 November 2021, 23:30:00” with the “Price” tab selected, in the Eastern Time Zone. Note, this 23:30:00 candle lists the opening price for 11:00:00 PM ET and the closing price for 11:30:00 PM ET. To allow for updates, this market will resolve on the number listed for the referenced candle at exactly 11:50:00 PM ET, on November 14, 2021. Note: If the candlestick closing price is exactly 1.80, the market will resolve "No." If CoinGecko is unavailable at resolution time, another source will be used.

question: Will 227.5 million Americans have received at least one dose of an approved Covid-19 vaccination by November 15?
description:
This is a market on whether 227.5 million people in The United States of America will have initiated vaccination, according to the CDC COVID tracker, by the resolution date, November 15, 2021, 8:00 PM ET. 

This market will resolve to "Yes" if 227.5 million people or more are listed as having received their initial dose of vaccination by the resolution source. This only concerns the first dose of vaccination. For vaccines requiring two doses for inoculation, this market considers only the first dose as having initiated vaccination. 
This market will resolve to "No" if, for any reason, fewer than 227.5 million people have initiated vaccination by the resolution date. 

The resolution source for this market will be the official data published by the CDC available at https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#vaccinations, and will be checked at the resolution time. 

If the website is down, the most recently available data will be used to resolve the market. If the website is not down, this market will resolve according to the data as available immediately at the time of resolution, and resolution will not be delayed for the purpose of waiting for updated data from a specific date.
